citations.narrative:
There was no APHIS 7006 form completed for a litter of 6 puppies sold on April 13, 2024. Failure to keep and maintain
records on puppies sold on APHIS 7006 form makes it difficult to keep track of litters. Licensee must complete an APHIS
7006 form for all dogs and puppies sold. Correct by April 19, 2024.

A review of records had all 3 copies of APHIS form 7006 retained by the licensee since January. A copy of the sale form
must accompany each dog of puppy sold to keep track of animals. Licensee must ensure that one copy of the record
(APHIS form 7006) must accompany each dog or puppy sold or disposed of. Correct by April 19, 2024.

Storage. There were 3 open bags of bedding in the hall of the kennel. Open bags of food and bedding must be stored in a
manner that protects supplies from spoilage, contamination, and pests. Licensee must ensure that open bags of bedding
are stored in leakproof containers with lids to protect supplies from pests and contamination. Correct by April 22, 2024.
This inspection and exit interview were conducted with the licensee.
Additional Inspectors:
Catherine Beckwith, Supervisory Animal Care Specialist
Jeffrey Shepherd, Assistant Director n

narrative:
2.75(a)(2) 
   
Records: Dealers and exhibitors. 
There was no APHIS 7006 form completed for a litter of 6 puppies sold on April 13, 2024. Failure to keep and maintain 
records on puppies sold on APHIS 7006 form makes it difficult to keep track of litters. Licensee must complete an APHIS 
7006 form for all dogs and puppies sold. Correct by April 19, 2024. 
2.75(a)(4) 
   
Records: Dealers and exhibitors. 
A review of records had all 3 copies of APHIS form 7006 retained by the licensee since January. A copy of the sale form 
must accompany each dog of puppy sold to keep track of animals. Licensee must ensure that one copy of the record 
(APHIS form 7006) must accompany each dog or puppy sold or disposed of. Correct by April 19, 2024. 
3.1(e) 
   
Housing facilities, general. 
Storage. There were 3 open bags of bedding in the hall of the kennel. Open bags of food and bedding must be stored in a 
manner that protects supplies from spoilage, contamination, and pests. Licensee must ensure that open bags of bedding 
are stored in leakproof containers with lids to protect supplies from pests and contamination. Correct by April 22, 2024. 
 
This inspection and exit interview were conducted with the licensee. 
 
Additional Inspectors: 
Catherine Beckwith, Supervisory Animal Care Specialist 
Jeffrey Shepherd, Assistant Director n
